description:
I have ordered either take out or delivery from Wok Station a couple of times.  They really do pay attention to all the special needs I have. I don't really have difficult special needs. I just don't like green onions and ginger. However green onions and gingers are the essential ingredients or garnish for almost all Chinese dishes.  8 out of 10 times you request no green onions and no ginger at Chinese restaurants, you still get them in your food.  

Not at Wok Station. Well at least not so far.  I do appreciate things they do or don't do to please the customers.
author: W C.

description:
This place sucks. Their chicken was so over cooked it tasted like it was dehydrated with tons of sweet n sour sauce on it. So gross. The chefs special is a joke honestly. Oxtail was rubbery and the sweet smell of it just didn't sit right with me. Crab puffs were way overfilled for their size but had no real cream cheese in them which negated the amount of imitation crab used. I ended up giving my food to a housemate who ate it but wasn't big on it either. 

Never ordering from them again.
author: Bella B.

description:
Quantity over quality, so this is a fine place to stretch your dollar, but don't expect a flavorful meal. I ordered kung pao chicken, green beans, and hot & sour soup, all of which were shockingly bland and zero heat on the normally spicy chicken. 

Portions are large, order was early, delivery person was kind and friendly.
author: Suganthi J.

description:
The most underwhelming food that I have had lately.

I got Kung Pao Meatless Chicken. I assumed it was some sort of Chicken substitute but what it actually is turns out to be giant chunks of soggy fried tofu floating around in a lot of oil with some vegetables. It's supposed to be spicy, it's not; it's just greasy. It was way too greasy (leaking everywhere with still an inch inside the container) and I don't mind some grease, either.

I asked them to make the Pineapple Fried Rice vegetarian by substitute egg for chicken. While they were nice enough to do this what I got was a oversize serving of greasy rice with some egg and 8 small pieces of pineapple mixed in. It had virtually no flavour aside from the pineapple. There was also absolutely no vegetables in it. It's one of the few times when I genuinely wish I'd invested the effort to cook at home.

Basically, if you don't eat meat this is an extremely disappointing meal. It's not the worst thing on the planet but in a city with so much good, cheap food it is overpriced for what you get and feels like a let down. It feels like they feel they have to do huge portions rather than good food. It's not horrible but in a city with so much food it's not very competitive unless you're just looking for a place that serves medium to large portions and don't care much for flavour. It's not horrible, just incredibly bland and sometimes too greasy.
author: A J.

description: Probably the worst restaurant on Irving. I ordered the Singapore rice noodle and it was so gross. Chunks of curry powder or whatever they use is all over. It was so dry and awful. I couldn't even eat it. You can literally see the chunks in the photo.
author: Darlene T.

description: Decent meal given the economic price. If you get Groupon, it's even cheaper. Will go back for lunch for sure.
author: Eggie S.

description: Ordered the salt & pepper chicken wings and black bean chicken on ubereats last night and it was the worst shit I ever tasted. The meat on the wings were still pink when I took a bite. I spat that shit out and threw it away. I guess salmonella is free of charge here. The black bean chicken was bland and flavorless and the vegetables in the stir fry were completely raw and crunchy. Like can you even call this chinese food and get away with it? I know the place is an express joint but you still have to cook the food to serve it to customers. We had to end up completely throwing our entire order. Such a waste.
author: Harry L.

description: It takes effort to make chinese food taste this bad. Fried Rice tasted like it was cooked on an electric stove (surprising since the name of this place is WOK STATION). Bland flavor and no rice separation. I had to re stir fry to add salt and soy sauce. Salt and Pepper Chicken wings tasted like they added lemon pepper to make it sour. My fault for not believing the reviews
author: Ryan A.

description:
I was so hungry and Being 10pm on a Wednesday this place caught my attention. I ordered to eat at the restaurant and got broccoli beef and chicken fried rice, about $24:/ 
the order came quick(1+) and staff was nice.

We were given paper plates which is not a big deal but paying this much I'd expect at least some real plates.
The broccoli beef was sooo watery, I'm talking no gravy just steamed broccoli water over the dish. The meat was chewy and not very good quality. This is a staple and easy to make Chinese dish and I almost always order it at every Chinese restaurant I eat at. 

I give this place a single star because of the price was overly expensive and quality of food was poor. An average for what I pay for this quality of Chinese food would be around $6.50-7.50 and that's being dead honest.
author: Ted L.

description:
So let's talk about just how bad this place really is...

Have YOU ever had to come home and re-cook $30+ of Chinese food? Because that's what just happened to us.  My husband turns to me and says "Honey,  please fix it. I sincerely don't want to throw it away."  
Why?  Because we just had 3 bites of the crappiest food ever ordered in San Francisco - Home of Amazing Chinese Food! 

Yes, the House Fried Rice was absolutely tasteless and eggy. The wasn't seasoned,  the rice wasn't seasoned, it was an evil and rogue combination of all the things you MUST SEASON (beef, chicken, eggs, white rice and 3 undercooked shrimp) thrown together in a pan. 

Yes, the Mongolian beef was made with a TOMATO based sauce. The beef was completely UNDERCOOKED (see picture) and the beef was so poorly sliced (thick dense pieces and thin tiny pieces mixed) it was practically impossible to chew properly. There was again very little seasoning and there was just simply nothing good about this dish. 

Lastly, we have the Black Bean Sauce Chicken. Watery - absolutely.  Tasteless - just about completely. 

Wait! I almost forgot DON'T LOOK BEHIND THE NON-EXISTENT STEAM TABLE! It's disgusting! It was dirty, covered with paper and other mixed media AND they had green beans, I presume that were to be prepped for further use.  C'mon! 

Rice was fixed with simple soy sauce and white pepper and a little garlic. 

Mongolian beef was corrected with chili oil, pepper, and soy sauce. 

Chicken was corrected with corn starch, water, soy sauce and pepper.

YOU people should be ashamed of yourselves with these fake YELP REVIEWS!  This place is just gross! 

Oh and for those tantalizing two chicken wings? 
Be prepared to be very pissed off because again,  they are unseasoned flavorless fried pieces of hairy chicken flesh!

Again I ask WHY?
author: Milan F.

description:
I was craving fried rice and wanted to try a new spot. Since the roommate wasn't super hungry and didn't care where we ordered from, I picked Wok Station. Placed our dinner delivery order on Tuesday, July 4th at 7:07pm through Eat24. It arrived at 7:33pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings (6 Pcs): Fried chicken wing with salt and pepper ($6.75)
*Lemon Chicken: sauce on side ($8.75)
*House Special Fried Rice: no carrots ($10.75)
*Free Spring Rolls with order of $25 or more before tax: (3 Pcs) Fried spring rolls with mixed vegetable only (normally $4.75)

The fried rice fulfilled the craving, but it didn't have much stuff in it. I expected peas and more meat. It was fried nicely, but a little bland. Nothing some hot chili oil couldn't fix. The chicken wings were also nicely fried, but they were a little too salty with not much peppery flavor. We joked they should be called just salt wings. I'm not a big lemon chicken fan, but the roommate basically ordered it with the sauce on the side so he could eat it with tonkatsu sauce. Kind of like pieces of chicken karaage. The free egg rolls were standard. I normally have meat egg rolls, but these were veggie. At least they were free.

Decent Chinese delivery spot. (Though they did forget to include hot sauce when I made a note for extra hot sauce to be included in our order.) Not the best Chinese food around, but I'm glad I checked out a new spot.
author: Elena N.

description: this place is decent and every time I've ordered delivery it's been fresh and hot. I haven't had the experience that other yelpers have. delivery is fast and food has been good :)
author: Tracy L.

description:
Me and my fds like this place so much, we like to order the lunch specials after school. The Prices are reasonable!!!The best Chinese restaurant for students!!!

Here's one of favorite !!!!Ginger and Onion with Fish
author: MaryYan K.

description:
Laughable ox tail stew with dry rice and equally dry but free two chicken wings.

Um, like my roommate was saying who just tosses raw ginger at the end and expects it to cook?

Rounding up because the service was nice but super overpriced at almost $20 for just a rice plate (yes I bought rice on the side).
author: Jack R.

description:
Eh. I ordered lunch delivered and I wasn't impressed at all. Had to order two lunch specials for the delivery. Thought I could just save one for tomorrow. Nope. 

I got the Mongolian beef and sweet and sour chicken and they tasted the same. I think they put chicken in both and messed that part up. And the sauces were almost identical save the different veggies. Very little flavor other than sugar as well. 

The Hot and sour soup tasted more like sweet and sour sauce with mushrooms. And the egg roll was more dough and oil than veggies. 

Granted I got two meals out of this for $16...you get what you pay for. I won't be ordered from here again or dining in.
author: Michael P.

description:
This place is DANGEROUS! Because I almost died. 
I ordered a Kung Pao Pork Lunch Special; a delivery from Doordash. You can immediately see that the rice is not freshly cooked (from the picture, the rice is yellow). I placed my order around 11AM, so the rice was the leftover from yesterday. I worked at a restaurant before, no Asian restaurant re-use the rice from a day before. 
Few minutes later, biting into one of the chunks of rice, I could not believe it. 
After one bite, I felt something hard.
The rice had hard plastics, not even one of those slimy ones, but REAL hard plastics. 
I thought about it, I could've died if I gulped down the whole piece of the plastic. Imagine your loved one, a baby niece or younger sibling gulped down one of these and yeah worse case scenario. The health department needs to do something. 
I would not order from this place again. This place does not deserve even one star.
author: Youngree K.

description: So we got food from DoorDash and I ordered fried crab wontons. It was dry and had a weird taste to it. It was just straight up imitation crab no cream cheese or seasoning. I even had it with sweet and sour sauce and it still didn't taste right.
author: Mela A.

description:
Compare to other restaurants on this street, they are food are way cheaper and they have a lot of choices! They also do delivery! For free!!

Around dinner time, it's always a long line so if you want to try their nice food, remember to go there earlier!

Don't settle with their bento, try order dishes and it's nice too!
author: Xintong P.

description: Mongolian beef lunch special is a must try! And house special fried rice and chow mein taste guys too! Great place for pick up/take out!
author: Bobo H.

description:
The reviews on here are really mixed. Half say it's bad and the other half say it's good. I've definitely had a good and bad experience here. The first time, I ordered the Mongolian beef lunch special and that was okay. Food came out fast and it was your basic Mongolian beef, it's almost impossible to mess that up lol.

The second time, I phoned in an order for pick up and wanted the scrambled egg with shrimp over noodles. Instead, I got scrambled egg with shrimp over rice. Uhhhhhhh not okay. I specifically wanted noodles. I paid $10 for a dish I basically already had all the ingredients to cook at home. I was on a lunch break at work and wouldn't have time to go back to the restaurant to complain (not that I would want to deal with crazy Irving Street traffic anyways) so I just ate it. I wasn't impressed and was still pretty disappointed that I didn't get my noodles. I probably won't be back because of this especially when there's so many other Chinese restaurants in the area to choose from.
author: Cindy F.

description:
Nice place for fast Chinese food! If you are looking for delicious food at the same time you're in a hurry, this place is the best choice. 
I ordered a BBQ pork fried rice from Wok. Unexpectedly tasty, fast and convenience plus you will get a large portion in one order. I will definitely visit on next time!
author: An X.

description:
Service 5/5
Food 4.5/5 
Environment was okay, acceptable but best for take out
What I have to say is they really take care of customer's special needs.
author: Foodieeee H.

description:
Not too bad for Chinese delivery!

I ordered the Spicy Tofu and Pork lunch special and the Mixed Vegetable Chow Mein during lunch. Food came piping hot in about 30min, despite Eat24 status indicating that it would be about an hour. 

Lunch special came with hot and sour soup and a egg roll. Soup was tasty. Egg roll was nice and crispy, although the vegetable filling was a little boring and bland. I enjoyed the Spicy Tofu, just the right amount of heat and perfectly with rice. There were only a few pieces of pork, which didn't bother me since I was more craving tofu, but might be disappointing for others.

Veggie Chow Mein had tons of vegetables which is great, but it was quite bland. It desperately needed more salt and flavors. The veggies taste like they were boiled or steamed, and then tossed in the noodles last minute for a quick mix. I was pigging out and started eating the noodles after I inhaled the tofu. But I just couldn't eat more than two bites of this. Luckily, I feel like this is something I could easily fix with a hot wok and some salt/sauce in my own kitchen so the food won't go to waste. The portion was pretty big though.

All in all, nothing too crazy special about this place. But if you are looking for a no-frills Chinese delivery, this seems like a reasonably priced and convenient option.
author: Nana L.

description: I stopped by this restaurant last night for some salt and pepper chicken wings without too much expectation since I am a very picky eater. But the amazing food and service here definitely made me want to come back.
author: Kim H.

description: This is my favorite place for Chinese food. My friend and I ordered beef with broccoli and beef fried rice. Its very yummy. I love this place so much. You can check in on yelp for chicken wings. Much try this place when you are around. Also, the delivery is very fast. Service is nice.
author: Jjinyan Z.

description: The chicken fried rice was fresh and delicious. It didn't have any plastic parts. The sesame chicken was over cooked. The chowmein was awesome. The fried prawns were fabulous. The beef was good. My children who lived in China said the "dumplings were on point." The delivery service was perfect.
author: Tammy M.

description: I just have to give these people FIVE stars for being so flexible on making adjustments on my food. YES i am making EFFORTS to eat healthier whenever i can, and they were very accommodating to the changes i wanted to make to my food. Most chinese places throw a ton of soy sauce, sodium etc, so i ordered delivery that came in time, less salty and still delicious!! Thank you Wok Station!
author: Moto B.

description: Long story short, their house special fried rice is recommended, no complains at all, no matter the portion, taste, quality of the ingredient, unbeatable in town. A must try dish.
author: Lynne L.

description:
I hate giving bad reviews but I feel like I just wasted $60. 

Delivery took 2 hours. 

All the food was either terribly bland or salty. 

Do not trust the 4 star Yelp rating!
author: Charlie A.

description:
Hey Panda Express lovers out there! Wok station coming through! This is a small cozy Chinese restaurant in the Outer Sunset offering a selection of entrees and lunch combo plates. I for one, came during during time and selected a couple of entrees from the menu. However, I do want to come back and give their lunch combo a try! 

Food 4/5:
What I really liked about Wok Station was that each dish was made to order and hot right off the wok.  [Ordered: walnut prawns, egg fried rice, and eggplant tofu]

Price 3.5/5:
I would have to say a meal here will run you an extra dollar or two compared to other Chinese restaurants in the Sunset and Richmond District.

Service 5/5:
Service went beyond my expectations. As the server brought each and every dish to our table, he said "enjoy!" paired with a smile. I really took notice to this simple remark and appreciated the customer service. Not to mention, before my BF and I left the restaurant they both greeted with an enthusiastic "thank you, bye!" It really seems like these guys truly take great value in their customers.
author: Briana H.

description: Really good food. So fresh! I got chicken with string beans and it was steaming hot. I felt like it wasn't too greasy, salty, or unhealthy. It was delicious. Reasonable prices. I would come back for lunch for sure.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Take out place that is matched against its peers like Panda Express... Ranking far superior.

The walnut prawn is juicy and bug plump pieces... Yum 
Beef here of any variant like Mongolian is also delish and juicy.

fried chicken wing as it needs more Chinese salt and pepper.

Cheap fast and generally delish has me returning again and again.
author: David H.

description: This is my second time ordering from here, and they did not disappoint. Food was freshly delivered and tasted great.
author: Sergio S.

description: Their lunch special is intelligent design! Rice, soup, dish, and spring roll. Their front desk is polite and helpful! Will come back again!!!
author: Yanxin C.

description: I was here last week and I've had the most amazing garlic noddle ever.ive had garlic noodle at other place before,but this one is the best.i will come back for more
author: Boris C.

description:
Encouraged to order through Eat24 app by reviews, but I wasnt very happy when my order arrived.  The food was cold and a full order of Sesame Chicken was about a quarter of the To-Go box.  Literally looks like the cook gave me what was left for the night.  I would not recommend this restaurant at this time to anybody.

*Edit*  Restaurant called back after initial post.  The woman on the phone was incredibly gracious.  Will revise review.  I am encouraged by the customer service at Station Wok.
author: Zachary B.

description:
My roommate bought take out from this place yesterday and it was very delicious. :D
The beef chow fun looked and tasted great! Definitely will order here again!
author: Shelley C.

description: For $40 you think you get rice. I have eaten Chinese food all over the country, and you don't not have to order rice separate it comes with your meal. What a rip off buyer beware!
author: Cary L.

description:
This might be my new spot for Chinese food!

Decided to try because I was sick of all the options on Irving and was craving something fatty since I was sick

Ordered egg/scrambled shrimp noodle and braised oxtail.

So good

The noodles had a right amount of salty but not over powering. Huge portions!

Oxtail was very tender but I wish it was marinated in a different sauce? Maybe more tomatoish? But portions was very big and no fat! Love! Came with potatoes and carrots.

My tummy was happy and I think I felt better too!
author: Carol Y.

description: I am impressed. As you might know I am a Restauranteur. Salt and pepper fried pork steaks. Walnut prawns. Don't listen to bad reviews. Those are just haters looking for attention. This review is unbiased. I just live in the neighborhood.
author: Narit B.

description:
We were looking for a place that can deliver our dinner since we were running around to our kids' events. I searched Eat24 and found Wok Station. Placed an order online for a 630 pm delivery. 

They came 1/2 an hour before the delivery time and the food was piping good hot. 

We got free egg rolls which were good. Honey walnut prawns with whole half walnuts.  Sesame chicken with big pieces of chicken and minimal breeding. And tofu mixed vegetables. All were excellent except the tofu. It could use more veggies.  The egg rolls were free and so was the delivery. What's not to like?

Would definitely consider them for take out again!
author: Wendy H.

description: Wok Station alway the best choice for us to have when we have parties and event:))) they have great customer service and there Chicken wings, noddles are really good!!!! I strong recommend wok station, if you like Chinese food and crispy fried chicken!!!!:))))
author: Christy O.

description:
This is a brand new place that just opened, and it bucks one of the biggest SF trends - rising prices. Their lunch combo of soup, 2 items, and rice for $5 is an incredible deal, and it's on par with most of the hole-in-the-wall bakeries in this area - except that the interior is super nice (it was obviously renovated just before they opened).

The owner, Mike, was incredibly excited, engaging, and happy to have his new business off the ground. He gave all of us a lot of nice freebies, including egg rolls and soup refills. He also gave us the lunch special deal on dinner items. Kudos to him for making my visit an awesome one.

Of course, the defining feature of restaurants, at least to me, is the quantity of food * awesomeness of the food / price. How did they stack up? Really well! As mentioned above, the prices were great. I got a mongolian beef, and it's one of the best I've had - especially noteworthy since it came from a fast-service style restaurant (instead of a sit-down restaurant). 

Another defining features is that the service at lunch time should be super speedy since it's counter-service from a steam tray. They offer delivery throughout sunset, too. The inside isn't huge, but the neighborhood has a couple parks that aren't too far away if that becomes an issue. 

All in all, this is a very welcome addition to the neighborhood from some really friendly folks. I can't wait to go back.
author: Chris S.

description:
Not good, not bad.  

In terms of food, it would be "eh, I've had better", so 2 stars.  One extra star earned for being on Postmates so I could order from work.

We ordered the chicken corn soup, which came extra hot like how I like it.

Mongolian beef was a-ok.  

Shanghai dumplings were hard, thick and something I would pass on.  

I wouldn't make this a recurring spot to order from, but if nothing else is open, I think they'd be ok.
author: Vi Y.

description:
I found a piece of metal in my beef string beans. What a shame; I was going to give them a decent review while I was eating my take-out lunch from them until I found the nice lunch bonus in my mouth. 

I've been here many times. Some dishes were better than others, and the prices are reasonable. They are in my neighborhood so they are very convenient. I have to feel confident this won't happen again before I change my review.
author: Opal L.

description:
I ordered from yelp 24 eats for lunch for myself and two children. The kids loved what they ordered! Always happy when it makes my children happy. They loved the sesame chicken (non spicy) and the chow mein (carrots and broccoli only). The non spicy order of the string beans was flavorful, cooked right, and still not spicy - which I appreciate. Many restaurants do not understand "not spicy". This was a perfect lunch order.

Oh and did I mention, they arrived 17 minutes before the delivery time. That was an added bonus. Great service.
author: Monique P.

description: They had me at free delivery. Crab wontons that actually taste like/contain a good amount of crab?! Wow yes! Delivery was super speedy too. That being said, the sweet&sour chicken was underwhelming. The portion was rather small (enough for two people to share without leftovers but the box wasn't even full all the way?) You have to order rice as it does not come with the meal. Sauce was good but there were no pineapples!? The meat was fine. Would order again just for the crab wontons though.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Very good food. The delivery guy is very fast with the deliveries. Friendly service too, highly recommended.
author: Kevin L.

description: I came here a few time for the lunch special since I work near Irving, I tried the mongolian beef,  kungpao chicken, and scramble egg with shrimp over rice and it tasted delicious. Order, while waiting served me soup (knows how to serve a customer well). I wouldn't say it's the best Chinese food on Irving but for 7.50 I can't complain, also I save a lot of time eating here since I only have a 45 minutes lunch break. I also ordered the wor wonton soup, sweet and spicy chicken wing, and singapore noodle for delivery to my office, and took them about 30-35 min before arriving (maybe I'm close by), told the delivery boy I couldn't leave my office so the delivery boy came up to my office, worth the delivery fee, and plus worth to give tips! I will definitely come back and try other food!
author: Edmond C.

description: So expensive for unappealing food. Just ordered sweet & sour pork, salt & pepper chicken wings, hot & sour soup and Shanghai dumplings. The sweet and sour pork was some questionable meat with a strange flavor. The bones in the wings cracked in our mouths, the soup didn't taste like it was supposed to and we got only 4 cold dumplings. Do not order from this place!
author: Lexi L.

description: Their $7.50 lunch special makes this one of my go-to spots for lunch in outer sunset. I highly recommend this place to anyone in the neighborhood!
author: Ryan C.

description: Cool friendly Chinese fast food restaurant in the neighborhood, good price, friendly staff. Will come again when I crave Chinese food !
author: Maggie L.

description: I ordered delivery from Wok Station for the first time last night. I'm really not sure how they have a 4-star rating, as this was some of the most disappointing Chinese food I've had. I ordered the Cashew Nut with Chicken, which was described as being made with chicken breast, but it came with all pieces of dark meat and peanuts instead of cashews. Cashew chicken with no cashews?? The pork fried rice was really bland, and mainly had pieces of fat instead of meat. I called the restaurant, and the woman I spoke with was very kind - she spoke with the manager and said they would credit our entire order. In the end, I received credit for one entree and the hot and sour soup (which was actually good). However, I won't be ordering from here again based on the overall food quality and flavor.
author: Alicia A.

description: I like their house special fried rice and veggie spring rolls, fried rice with prawns chicken and beef, not so oily and salty, healthy food.
author: 艺静

description:
Arrived at 11:30 and was told that they were not ready for business (even though they opened at 11). 
Used a Groupon and the lady didn't seem too happy about that. She didn't smile or seem remotely happy to be at work. 
2 lunch specials at $7.50 each would take about 20 minutes. 
I checked in on yelp and presented the voucher for 2 free chicken wings. She seemed irritated that I asked for the checkin offer. 
Haven't even tried the food yet but we are off to a rough start.
author: Terence L.

description: Pretty ok food for the price. Wasn't too bad, I got the crab ragoons, and they were filled with crab. The pork fried rice though was filled to the brim with egg. No carrots or peas like I'm used to either.
author: Kathryn S.

description: Ordered via Eat24 because of the pictures, everything had a visual and they looked realllllly good. I got the food on time and the asparagus chicken is alright but looks nothing like the picture. The chicken pineapple fried rice is pretty whatevs... it's like canned pineapple chunks with super small end pieces of chicken and the rice doesn't have the flavor of either.
author: Jillian K.

description: I order a chow fun yesterday, that was tasty. Food delievry is fast. I think this place is better than panda. If you still finding some places for Chinese Food, this is a nice place to go to. Also, you can order food online!
author: Alan H.

description: I don't know why this place has 4 stars. It just tastes like typical Chinese-American takeout food. I would give it 3 stars, but I felt nauseous from the hot and sour soup. Delivery was fast though (and still hot!) so props to that. But I don't want to eat food and feel nauseous from it, so I must give it 2.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Excellent place to get authentic Chinese! Fast service and delicious food. I usually order there every other week. My favorites are: Mongolian chicken, vegetable fried rice, sesame chicken, and spring rolls.
author: Joana S.

description: Like it so much. Good price and nice food. My order completed so fast.
author: Thera C.

description: We have been to this place for several times now as my son cannot find any other place that serves better fish cod with sweet corn than what he tried here.  The portion is pretty good for two kids' dinner with some left over.  I like this place mainly because it's obviously with less MSG than other places.  I wasn't that thirsty like having Chinese food from other places, nor   urging for drinking several glasses of water to flush the MSG out of my body after meals.  We usually do to-go orders as we love their super fast service, and we could avoid finding parking in that busy area.  We called to order from 20 minutes away and they usually got the orders ready.
author: Irene F.

description:
Just ordered take out from here for the first time.

Steamed BBQ pork buns: tasteless.

Pineapple & Chicken fried rice: tasteless. I don't think it was even seasoned, I had to add my own salt and pepper. Pineapple had no taste. There was barely any chicken in it--it was mostly a box of soggy rice with no seasoning and I have my doubts it was even fried, looked/tasted more like steamed rice.

Would not order from again.
author: Geoff W.

description: Where's the beef...I mean pork? Hardly any pork in the chow mein. The lemon chicken was fairly good but the portion was small and no rice. I have never been to a Chinese restaurant that didn't serve at least a small bowl of white rice with an entree. When I asked, I was told "rice is extra". I wish I would have known that before my take-out order was ready.  Also, there was a lady sitting at a table eating and right in the middle of me placing my order, she starts a conversation in Chinese with the lady taking my order. I felt like I was in the Seinfeld episode where Elaine is having a pedicure and everyone in the salon starts speaking a foreign language and laughing. I did not very feel welcome there even though I was the only other customer in the place. I have been to several different Chinese places in the Sunset area and have always been treated graciously so this was a disappointment.
author: Kim B.

description: I often visit this small Chinese restaurant. Order to go, my favorite dish is house special chow mein and hot and sour soup. Price is reasonable and they accept credit card too, compare to other Chinese restaurant only accept cash.
author: Claire H.

description: Pretty good priced and authentic Chinese/Cantonese food! Soooo many options and chef specials to choose from and the chow mein is just a bomb! Servers there are super friendly and helpful. Been there a couple times and was very happy about the food and service! Will definitely go there more often to try new items! Besides, free delivery and the location is super convenient! Strongly recommend!!!
author: Shui J.

description:
Terrible food via delivery. I ordered meatless Kung pao and soy noodles on the side. Terrible. The Kung Pao was pretty much huge chunks of soggy tofu and tiny pieces of squash cut into quarters. No seasoning or sauce, not spicy at all! Just bad really. The soy noodles on the side were just as bad with no flavor and plain. Not even sriracha could save the plate.

I wasted my money on this meal. 1 star at best.

Only reason I give it another star is because once I ordered a chicken with veggie that was good.
author: Karla Emm N.

description: Too many vegetables in the Kung Pao Chicken for $10.95, very little taste as well in general.
author: Timothy P.

description: Generous portion (apart from the little slice of cheesecake!), arrived speedily. Tasty and filling, would recommend!
author: Alistair P.

description:
The pictures put up for this restaurant seemed very appealing, but when I got my order, it looked nothing at all like the pictures. The Sweet and Sour chicken was the worst part of a chicken, with lots of veins and fat. This was the fattiest meat I've ever had. The oil was disgusting. Their Chow Main was super oily and had no seasoning whatsoever. Their Kung Pao chicken was nothing but chicken fat, peanuts, and oil. Honestly, I think that it is outrageous that they call themselves a restaurant when the food looks like instant noodles made with a ton of oil and fat by a 10 year old child. This food is not even fit for consumption, and I doubt the people who work at Wok Station even eat their own food. 

1/10. Do not eat here.
author: Jenifer J.

description:
Wok Station is in the Spud spot. came for the special. lucked out on parking space in front with time on it.

menu: steam table with dozen entrees, looked anemic. 
wings suggested passed. not a fave.

eats: rice with broculli beef, kao pao chicken(4.99)  soup also if in house
-rice best part
-broculli, beef chewy, chicken bland
-mystery taste, couldn't finish till evening.
-no msg but something else is present, chicken broth?
3.5 stars for value, ambience, quick service, food rating near 3.

take outs:
-2 free wings with yelp check-in, checked  in after leaving.
never thought chinese eatery would have freebies during check-ins.
-regular pricing seems very reasonable, hopefully tastes better too.
author: Victor G.

description: I love this place!! They are fast, clean, tasty and the girl at the register is super nice... delivery was a little slower than I thought but the food is great!!!
author: DEANNA W.

description: The food is very  good, they can take to deliver too, too many food to order. They make the order right away, properly 15 mins wait for 3 orders. The waitress is nice, and attitude is good too. Will order again
author: Run W.

description: 6pm on monday: Just had to walk out without ordering anything because no one wanted to take my order... I pretty much just stood there for 5 mins while one worker talked to a driver and the other worker just counted money right in front of me. She made eye contact with me many times but no hi or greeting whatsoever asking if i wanted anything. Pretty bad service.  No idea on quality of food since i couldn't order anything.
author: Brian L.

description: Ordered shrimp dumplings and the dim sum combo for delivery. The food came fast and taste good! Strongly recommended if you'd like some good price Chinese food/dim sum.
author: Yuan Z.

description: Good Chinese fast food restaurant, grub and go in 15 Mins ,  I got the lunch service broccoli beef , come with spring roll and hot and sour soup. I can't finish the whole thing. Good idea for lunch , may try again
author: Christina M.

description:
The won ton soup , lemon chicken , salt and pepper chicken wings and salmon fried rice were all excellent ! Curry chicken nothing special! The flavor was excellent and very authentic !
Best Mongolian beef ever
author: Yee W.

description:
It was Chinese New Year.  It's also a tradition to have a family dinner on the day of Chinese New Year.  I have a big family.  30+ people!  Instead of hustling in a Chinese restaurant, we decided to cater food for our family.  Wok Station was referred by a friend.  So we decided to give them a try.

Not only the food had so many varieties and the tastes were very authentic and good.  They were also very accommodating because we have family members don't eat a certain spices and spicy dishes.  They were able to make adjustments and recommendation on our orders to suit our tastes.  The delivery was on time so the food was still hot when they arrived.

Overall experience was great.  I would of given it a 6 Start rating. They will be on my top list for any future parties and events catering.
author: Michael L.

description: We ordered beef with stir fried rice noodle and fried chicken wings combo meal for our lunch. Since we were there eating, the waitress even offered us a bowl of soup for free. The food came out great (hot and tasty). Not a typical fast food restaurant, they are make to order. So, the food comes out hot and tasty.
author: Christopher L.

description: Chicken fried rice is good, and walnut prawns are fresh and the size of prawns are big too. I ordered grub and go, takes around 20 mins. The stuff is nice and give me a cup of water during the wait time. I will go back and try other dishes later. Please keep the good job!!
author: Sam Y.

description:
I bought six pieces of dim sum,two BBQ pork buns two shrimp dumplings two egg rolls . It was $9.0
This is not really a sit down restaurant, better get some Togo
author: Jaclynn C.

description: Lazy to go out for dinner by myself. Ordered Chinese food online, BBQ fried rice and sesame chicken. Food is average, but delivery is super fast. Unbelievable, hang up and delivery arrive !!! Super fast
author: Ar T.

description: The price was a little different online but not by much. The beef and broccoli was decent but the wonton soup was really yummy! I wish there was more wontons and veggies because there was A LOT of broth. So it wasn't a good ratio for the price of the soup. The delivery was quick so that was nice. I'd probably order again.
author: Tara A.

description: Don't eat here. I got sesame chicken and lemon chicken, and both were extremely soggy and chewy. Both dishes used way too much batter, making it taste super starchy and oily and weird. There are better Chinese restaurants in the area.
author: John M.

description: Finally I found a delicious Chinese food, I like to eat fried rice, and there are a lot of beef and shrimp, I've already told my friend about must going to try~~
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Stopped in here while doing laundry down the street. Picked it because it looked like it was going to be fast, but had to wait 20 min for my take out order anyway- wasn't in a hurry though so it was fine.

I ordered the Shanghai dumplings, hot and sour soup, and eggplant with garlic. While the first two were only ok, the eggplant with garlic was delicious! I'd come back again for that alone! I also noticed on their menu they have a vegetarian special that looks pretty good, so will probably try that next time with my boyfriend.

Even though I ordered take out, I ended up eating in the place. They have 3 small tables that are clean but definitely no frills.
author: Tony G.

description:
Ordered beef chow mein to go. Loving it! Will certainly come back for this. Decent price, friendly staff, and quick order. For a small restaurant like this, what else can u ask for? =) 

Tried it the second time, the foods are still above average quality. Third time coming soon!
author: CHARLES H.

description: Came in during lunch for their food. I ordered their corn and Chicken soup and salty fish fried rice. The food came out nice and hot and so yummy. Will come back next time to try other food on the menu.
author: Elmie C.

description: I love this place for multiple reasons. The staff is very friendly . Excellent service. Always pay attention what I need. The food is very good especially salt and pepper chicken wings. This is the best Chinese restaurant at Bay Area
author: Vincent W.

description: I've eaten here many times. All take out and had delivery 3 times. Delivery was fast for me and my food very hot. The food is tasty and seasoned well. I wish they were open a little bit later but other than that, no complaints here at all.
author: D J.

description: I made a call in order, the food is delivered earlier than expected. The order is warn, delicious and as described. The sauce are tasting good, I ordered dragon roll and spicy tuna roll, they are pretty good, they offer free delivery with $15 min. order. I will recommend my friend to order to go from this sushi place.
author: Titus H.

description: Ordered dim sum combo and chicken fried rice, it takes 35 mins for delivery to Richmond district. The dim sum still warm and taste good, chicken fried rice is good and no msg added. Overall good!!!
author: Ronald L.

description: Nice food. Really delicious. And fast delivery. Very competitive to the others in town.
author: David Y.

description: I was looking for a place for Chinese food and finally I found Wok Station and tried their Kung Pao Chicken and Mongolian Beef lunch special, the foods taste very good and worthy to try. I recommend this place!!!
author: Ryan Tai T.

description: Order grab and go, food is order to make style, wait time about 15 mins, food is good with large portion and the service is good too. Will go back again.
author: Andrew L.

description: Great Chinese, best in the area for sure. Quick and easy pick up. Wonderful owner, gets in and out quick for dinner and lunch.
author: Krysta J.

description:
We ordered the sweet and sour chicken, the spring rolls, and the house special chow mein. None of it was good. The sweet and sour sauce was weird, the spring rolls were mostly roll and not much spring in them, and the chow mein was just bland.

Not going to order from here again.
author: Don P.

description: Although the chicken quality was better than some restaurants, there was almost no flavor to the sesame and lemon chicken. The chicken itself was dry. Not worth the $. Won't recommend or return.
author: Jocelyn E.

description: Ordered through Yelp Eat 24. After waiting for an hour with no delivery I contacted Yelp. Order was confirmed but according to Yelp my order was never cooked. The Wok restaurant offered to cook my order at that point and rush it over asap. I decided to cancel as I didn't think a rush order would be any good. What a big disappointment. I would give -stars if I could!
author: Regina G.

description: Over price for Chinese American food, and the portion is too small, for the pork rib only 4 pieces for $10; I called to complain, they don't really care, and sound like that's what it suppose to be; won't come back anymore, there's lot more choices on Irving st
author: Serena J.

description: This is probably my favorite chinese place in the city. The food is really good and the service is great. Even when I try something new on the menu that I haven't had before I'm still satisfied. I'm never disappointed when I go to this place.
author: Angela B.

description: The food is pretty good. I order salt and pepper chicken wings and curry fish balls.those are very good.but the place is so small
author: Sai Lo L.

description: Wok station is always our best choice when we have events and parties. I love their fried chicken wings, curry fish balls and spring rolls. Their staffs are friendly and they always deliver on time. Thank you.
author: Judy Natsu G.

description: Had such high hopes, but this has to be some of the worst Americanized Chinese food I've had. It sort of seems like they buy frozen from somewhere and heat it up for you. And you only get some packaged bright pink sweet an sour sauce for things that have no business being near that stuff.
author: Ella M.

description: Kinda gross. The hot and sour soup was hot and bland and I think that was what gave me tummy troubles afterwards. The chicken and broccoli was coated in a thick layer of sort of congealed brown sauce that was totally tasteless. Overall, not good. Really disappointing - so much so that I'm tossing the leftovers. I want my money back!
author: Marilyn J.

description:
MSG makes me swollen and sick and lethargic. I can eat EVERYTHING here and not feel like that! They're MSG-free and are pretty much offer a fast-casual dining experience. I love coming here for their lunch specials (I believe it was $7.50) for an entrée, rice, soup, and an egg roll. I am usually disappointed when I order crab wontons of any sort because of the lack of filling. I swear, there was so much crab and cream cheese in them, that I was confused about I had actually ordered; there are only four, but they're good enough to keep me happy!

I love their chicken wings, which is what I've been swearing by, and their hot-sour soup is probably one of the better ones in the area. I definitely recommend this spot if you love Chinese food, but not the MSG that's commonly used.

Food: 8/10
Staff: 8/10
Atmosphere: 7/10
Overall: 7.6/10
author: Evan K.

description: The Fried tofu with mushroom is extremely well done. It is one of my favorites to get there.
author: Sherry T.

description: The Mongolian lamb and sesame chicken is very delicious. the price is pretty good as well.
author: Gunnar H.

description: Came here to get some lunch. I got the spicy chicken and string bean with rice Togo. When I got back to work and start eating the food it tasted very blan with no flavor. The string bean was very undercook and the chicken tasted ok and flavorful, I wish the whole dish would tasted that was too. The food it self was hot but it was not fully cook and it was not spicy like I asked just no flavor. Not coming back here again. Haven't been feeling well since I ate the food. Hopefully it's not food poisoning =(
author: C N.

description: I just visit this restaurant and ordered grab and go, I ordered house special fried rice, and spring rolls. The house special fried rice made with prawn, not the little shrimps. It tasted good and no msg, mainly favored by salt. The spring rolls are made with veggie which is more healthy. Will try again.
author: Sonny C.

description: I loved the lunch specials I ordered. They were healthy and tasty, and nicely priced. I ordered veggies soup, but I wanted to have chicken and ginger in it, and Wok Station did for me without any problems. Delivery service was great, too. Keep it up, Wok Station!
author: Lyon B.

description: Almost two hours for soggy sesame chicken with congealed sauce, the food was luke warm at best. Container was soggy and damp from sitting for so long. I will never use this place again
author: Sean R.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Easy to order delivery online and the best general kitchen. We like the string bean with prawns and veggie fried rice. Very long menu with lots of choices and friendly staff
author: Jiaying L.

description: I saw this little Chinese restaurant while walking on Irving street looking for to go order. They are made to order style, I ordered BBQ pork buns, hot and sour soup, and BBQ pork fried rice. The wait time is 15 mins. The order is fresh and hot, this place is better than Panda Express, and the price is reasonable. I may call in order delivery next time, since they offer free delivery.
author: ERIC N.

description: Food is really delicious. The food delivered was fast. I think this place is better than Panda!Friendly waitress and love ordering the salt and pepper chicken wing and Mongolian beef with rice
author: Chloe Z.

description:
For a Chinese gal reviewing Chinese food, it's nothing exciting, but it's still good.  I missed the $4.99 deal, but lunch special for $7 and change is ok; it includes a veggie spring roll and a soup.  I ordered the slippery egg & beef over rice as one of the employees suggested and it wasn't bad.  It's just as good as comfort food, not too shabby.

The other nice aspect to this restaurant is that if you order from them, they will deliver free anywhere in San Francisco ($15 min.).  They also cater, which is nice for people who may have events (i.e. birthdays potlucks, meetings, etc.) and need to feed large amounts of people; if you cater, they will take 10% off your order.  Overall 3.5 stars.
author: Jessica S.

description: The food took 2 hours! The driver was rude because he put in the wrong directions. Not to mention the sauces were all over the bag and containers they were in. Not to mention the food itself was cold and subpar. WILL NEVER CALL AGAIN. Told all my social media connections my horrible experience. Hopefully, they will never try this place out.
author: Kaitlin S.

description: Ordered through Yelp. It was immediately delayed, and then even after that they were 15m late after their delayed time. Fried foods came cold and soggy. I ordered the salt and pepper pork, mushrooms & veggies, and the chicken & salted fish fried rice. The food was ok compared to other places, nothing amazing.
author: Mike M.

description: I ordered from this restaurant via Eat24. They got one item wrong and they were late. They delayed my order first once my order got through and then they arrived at least 30 mins later than the promised time. I ordered sashimi combo and they gave me sushi combo. I understand the similarity between the two but they are different! The price is different! The food was ok.
author: Yutian L.

description:
I had a Groupon and ordered food for delivery this evening. Wok Station does not accept Groupons for delivery -- only for takeout or dine in. I was flustered about this when my food arrived... and the owner, who delivered my food, gave me my order! And explained that for next time, the Groupon was good for dine in or takeout only. I tried to pay, and give cash, but he just said no -- he wanted me to be happy and now I know for next time.
The delivery was speedy, the food arrived hot and yummy.
WOW! Yes, there will totally be a next time. And a fat tip. Thank you for your kindness!
author: Felicia G.

description: Ordered catering from these guys before and they were great! Food was VERY reasonably priced and everyone complimented on how delicious it was. Highly recommended!
author: Gary W.

description: Worst meal ever. Got the Groupon to eat in !!!! 3 tables  why did they have a Groupon dine in in a take out place?  One table out of three had the workers eating and talking.loud. Do not eat here. Do not get the Groupon   food was bad. There was no help. You order at the counter not at the table. I feel like I got taken which makes me hate Groupon. Never again!!!
author: Goldie N.

description: Stumbled upon this place and grabbed a quick bite.  Gotta say...prob the only Chinese take out spot where I actually finished the food.
author: tai t.

description: Ordered sweet and sour pork and mongolian beef for 2 of us. Portion is big and I cannot finish them all. The witness is nice with kindly service. We will order again if we don't want to make our dinner. $20 can fill up our stomach. Good deal.
author: Jason W.

description: Really tasty food there! I love mixed vegetables with chicken a lot! The dish is enough for two people to share. Two free chicken wings for checking in there.
author: Cecilia L.

description: Love this place. I always order from them and the experience with them is always outstanding. The food is always ready on time for me to easily pick it up. They always bag it up perfectly so that nothing ever leaks in my car. I always get the beef chow fun and it's always been created with the perfect amount of sauce and seasoning. Another favorite is the salt and pepper chicken wings, and it's so delicious. Definitely recommend if you've ever tried it before.
author: Jenni L.

description: I'm always saddened when Yelp steers me wrong. We ordered from here via eat24. I was not impressed. The wonton soup was so salty it was barely edible. The spring rolls were soggy. The fish with vegetables was actually fish with bok choy, and the only thing I could really taste at all was oil. The food reminded me of Americanized Chinese that I would find in a suburb somewhere in middle America. In trying to find something positive to say, it wasn't the *worst* Chinese food I've ever had.
author: Amy B.

description: Love the food and the portion. The fried chicken wings are very delicious, crispy and flavorful. Their egg noodle is just right , not too salty or oily. They give you a lot for their size.
author: Joyce C.

description: A new lunch place for me!!!! Ordered the sour & spicy soup which is super delicious, it's not that spicy but the texture is really good. Must try the spicy tofu beef with Rice. I ordered it in mild spicy which is just right my flavor. Definitely will come back when I didn't bring lunch to work. Must to mention the price is nice too.
author: Lily H.

description: This Chinese restaurant is opened for a while, and finally have a chance to try. I like their Korean style chicken wings, taste sweet and sour, the meat is juicy. Delivery time is within reasonable that was expected. I will try again next time when I have no dinner plan.
author: Cyn C.

description: First visit to this Chinese restaurant, ordered crab meat wonton, the cream cheese and crab meat taste good. Vegetable chow mein is not too oily and no msg added is a plus. I will try to order delivery online next time and see how quick they can deliver the food.
author: Wen Y.

description: Ordered Kung pao chicken and crispy noodles with shredded pork, delivery was delayed but arrived at the estimated time. Kung pao chicken was average, sadly the crispy noodles were soggy from delivery. Delivery might be better with other menu items!
author: Madeline M.

description: The food is only average.  Been here twice and took advantage of the Groupon deal.  Tried the veggie chow fun and it was not great.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Real good! The food was delivered fast and also very delicious. Especially the scrambled egg with prawns, the best prawns I tasted ever. The services were good and people are friendly! This was a nice experience and will come back next time!
author: Chung J.

description: This place is my favorite place for Chinese food so far. Food is always fresh, people welcomes you with smile, food made fast and tastes great!!! That is my 3rd time I eat lunch here and I am coming back for more. Highly recommended!
author: Vilius B.

description: Their Singapore style noodle is good compares to other. The noodle is well mixed with curry taste and not too salty. A BIG plus is there's no msg added on their menu, which is more healthier!
author: Wendy F.

description:
Summary - Totally mediocre. 

Braised tofu with vegetables was flavorless except for the occasional sharp flavor of garlic.  Also, way too much tofu and not enough vegetables.  My wife enjoyed her spicy eggplant dish, but I found it very average.

There are plenty of other options in the area.
author: Xaman E.

description: Ordering To-Go food is the way to go from this small whole in a wall restaurant.  I've ordered 2 times from here.  Delivery time, food quality and service was great!  For the 1st time, I ordered egg plant with spicy sauce, Curry Chicken Wings, and Sweet and Sour Pork was the BEST by far!  Second time, I ordered for a pot luck dinner I had to attend.  I ordered a Medium size party tray of Singapore Style Rice Noodle.  Everyone loved it!  This place is highly recommended for Party Trays.  Food portion is more than expected, great prices, on time with delivery.  I'm definitely a returning customer.
author: JLcam T.

description: Excellent food! Got a freebee for having a big order. Thanks!!!
author: Tessa M.

description: This is a great restaurant!! They have good service, and their delivery is fast. Definitely need to try out their fried rice.
author: Lily L.

description: This is my third time to eat the foods here,I ordered salt& pepper chicken wings,salmon fried rice,their new garlic noodles It tasted very nice I love it so much ,so greatly to try the food,I will try it again and again
author: Kyle L.

description:
Is it the best Chinese food?  No.  It appears clean and portions are decent.  Better than eating Panda Express I think.  I would eat here again for a quick fix of Chinese food without the table service.

Service is average.  Short curt conversation.

Not many seats so mostly a to go place.

I liked the Singapore noodles, chicken fried rice, and scrambled egg and beef.  Stay away from the chicken curry.  I have never tasted anything like it and it wasn't pleasant.  

Veggies seem fresh and the chicken wings was as pretty good.
author: Dennis S.

description: My favourite dish is the chicken wings, super crispy and juicy. And their delivery service is fast and good. 5 stars!
author: Emily L.

description: The food is descent and the staffs are super nice.  Highly recommended!  I have been ordering party trays from here and all my guests love it.
author: Hamachi K.

description: Been to Wok Station few times, never disappointed. Many options to choose from. This is a good place for some reasonable price, authentic Chinese food. Cheaper than cooking at home. Free delivery is unbeatable. 5 stars!
author: Gordon M.

description: Delicious beef string bean plate and cashew nut chicken. It's what I've had so far here and they're quite good! The prices are reasonable and when you order, the food is made fast.
author: Samuel S.

description: Like to come to wok station if I'm around in the sunset district. For a fast meal, the food is pretty good, the staffs are friendly, decent price. If you too lazy to cook this is a good place to call for a delivery.
author: Joanne T.

description: I won't be ordering from this restaurant again. I ordered delivery, and they didn't show up until an hour later they said they would. Plus, my food was cold! I only live a 15 min drive away, so it was ridiculous. I ordered hot and sour soup, and I can tell you I had better else where; same with the veggie chow mein. I wouldn't even call it veggie chow mein because it barely had any veggies in it! Just a few broccolis.
author: Sienna S.

description:
i come here on Friday night for dinner, the portion of foods big, and the price is fairly
i had order the shrimp dumplings, it tasty,  would come back again :)
author: Terrance G.

description:
I love this place! I've even gotten my mother and brother hooked.  They are pretty picky when it comes to Chinese food.

It's fast, cheap and delicious.  The ingredients taste fresh and of quality...even the steamed rice is soooo good.  I usually order their lunch specials which include rice, egg roll, and soup for only $7.50 for most dishes.  My go-to's are the mongolian beef, kung pao chicken, and the scrambled egg with shrimp flat rice noodles.  

I tried the fried tofu...it's a bit bland so I don't recommend that dish. Everything else I tried is really good.

I usually call ahead and order directly through the restaurant instead of eat24.  Eat24 charges restaurants a HUGE commission on each order.  Profit margins are already small and it is tough enough already to run a restaurant.

Try this place out.  Enjoy!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: This place did't look like much , but they seriously make the best mapo tofu I've ever taste ,it's tasty and the portion are huge , the stuff is also very friendly. Definitely my go to delivery spot.
author: Vivian Z.

description: Really not good. Ordered delivery and it showed up on time, but everything was bland and the sesame chicken was soggy and lukewarm.
author: Kelly B.

description: Very good service. Fresh cheap affordable. Free delivery very tasty . Come here all the time for lunch special
author: Al T.

description: I love the BBQ pork fired rice, and the salt pepper chicken wings. But the hot and sour soup a bit spicy though. Delivery is on time, so overall I love this place. I will recommend to my fiends too
author: Terence H.

description: I've just recently visit this place.  Originally, I thought it's just another Chinese fast food place, nothing special.  But I was wrong, their foods have restaurant's quality and have a great selection of dishes.  I'll definitely recommend this place to my friends.  Their service is excellent.
author: Keith L.

description: Ordered the Singapore vermicelli rice noodles on postmates. It was a huge portion and although it wasn't spicy enough and I should've got it more spicy, it fed like 3 people! Totally worth the price and will order this again! Food also came with a foil on the bottom so the food stayed hot, really thoughtful!
author: Ruby F.

description: Good food and nice people. They forgot an order of bonus 2 free chicken wings on the delivery and I didn't expect them to return because we told them it was ok, but they did anyway 5 minutes later with a whole order...very nice service!
author: Marcia T.

description:
Needs Improvement: Wonton soup lacking flavor. Was almost like lemon water. Cream cheese puffs were cold.
Chicken fried rice had little flavor, chicken undercooked, and lots of egg. No soy sauce delivered in bag. 

Positive: quick delivery, also came with 2 free cans of soda.
author: Shanon T.

description: I was in the area looking for quick Chinese food for lunch and came across this place in Yelp.  I decided to give a try and out of my expectation, it was really good.  It's not a big place but I was just ordering to-go.  The server gave great recommendation and I ordered the spicy tofu with beef and also check in at Yelp to receive my 2 free fried chicken wings.  It was fast and cheap, I will definitely try their online ordering next time.
author: Kevin L.

description: This is the best Chinese restaurant on Irving street. The service here is perfect and food is cheap. I ordered a shrimp fried rice and it was the best fried rice I ever had
author: Devin L.

description: Food was absolutely terrible. I purchased hot and sour soup, veggie fried rice, and veggie egg rolls through delivery. Food was lukewarm. Soup was inedible - ended up throwing it away after 1 bite. It was gelatinous and tasteless. Rice was overcooked and flavorless. Veggie egg rolls were OK but nothing better than that.
author: Jocelyn G.

description:
The food here is good but the place is not very clean.  Also the girl behind the counter is so 
unfriendly and unaccomodating.  I will not be coming back.  If I can give zero star, I would have done so.
author: Jenifer D.

description:
This review is for a lunch delivery order.

Was looking for Chinese lunch delivery and Wok Station popped up.  I liked that they had lunch specials at 7.50 and four stars, so I gave it a try.  Won't be doing that again.  

Ordered sweet and sour chicken and broccoli chicken.  Food took over an hour for delivery, about 15-20 minutes longer than estimated, not so bad.  The food was however.

My main complaint is that there were egg shells in my broccoli chicken.  None of our dishes called for egg, but there were hard pieces of broken egg shell throughout my dish.  My wife got the sweet and sour chicken and got four fried chicken nuggets next to some bell pepper and onion in the sauce.  Chicken was dry and not fried entirely.  Sauce wasn't the worst, but overall not a good experience.   Food was way over salted and and nothing stood out.  Best part were the egg rolls, but only by comparison.  The soup was hard to get down.  Overall not a good experience.  

I regretted this decision.  Thought I'd share.
author: Matt C.

description: I love this place. The staff is very kind and helpful. Always pay attention what i need. The food is good and hot. I like the salt and pepper chicken and the dimsum combo. Taste yummy.
author: Lisa Y.

description: Took over an hour and a half to get to my house.  Food is average at best.  Definitely much better options in the sunset.
author: a y.

description: My first time ordering so no I do not recommend again because the first time suppose to be a charm especially with ordering food . All my food tasted burnt. I called back for accommodation and they said sorry they don't do accommodations .  very unsatisfying . Will not be ordering here again .
author: Williams C.

description: OX tail is juicy with fresh tomato, I use the yelp check in and get 2 free chicken wings (they fried the chicken wings when you ordered, not pre fried). I can't believe that Chinese restaurant will offer free stuff for yelp check in. My recommendation for this restaurant is OX tails and egg fried rice.
author: Kelvin A.

description: Just tried their lunch menu, $7.50 with free soup and spring roll. Taste good with reasonable price. No msg is added. I work nearby the restaurant will try again. Recommended.
author: Krystal L.

description: Order at Yelp and after an hour of the promise time I called the restaurant and they pretended it's on its way. They did not do the order.
author: Rea C.

description: My bf loved the won ton soup.I particularly enjoyed the house special fried rice and walnet prawns! It's  so delicious ~
author: Ji G.

description: Ordered spicy beef with soft tofu over rice yesterday evening,  the spiciness is right at the spot!  The beef is tender too. The staff is very friendly and the place is bright and clean. I'm very satisfied.  Will definitely go back for second round! Keep up the good work Wok Station.
author: Kin C.

description: This place is not too bad, I stumbled upon this restaurant while waiting for a boba drink from iTea. It's like a more Asian version of Panda Express. They are fast and the lunch special is affordable. I got the Mongolian Beef lunch special and was surprised that there was a good amount of beef in it. Usually, if you go to any other Chinese restaurant and order a lunch special, they give you a lot of vegetables, rice, and a few pieces of meat. I'll probably try this place again when I'm looking for something fast. It's a 5 min drive from UCSF and a 30 min walk.
author: Vivi T.

description: Found two big long hairs stuck together in my food. Cooks must not wear hair nets. Disgusting.
author: Hugh M.

description: Some of the worst Chinese I've had in awhile. The only positive is we ordered delivery and it came within 20 min. Besides that it was a horrible experience. We ordered the sesame chicken which was soggy considering its fried. The chicken chow mein  had no flavor and the spicy string beans which didn't taste fresh. We had a few bites then went to get good food. I would never go back
author: Austen L.

description: Wok Station is a new Chinese restaurant in the Sunset district. The $5 deal with soup, 2 items and rice is unbeatable in San Francisco. I don't eat Chinese food outside so often because I hate the MSG. Wok Station is 100% NO MSG and the taste is great. The variety of the items make me want to go back everyday. The staffs are so nice and always pick the best items for me!! I highly recommend to add the egg rolls with the lunch deals. You won't regret to pay a little extra for it. The egg roll is the best in town!! The owner told me that Wok Station will serve Hong Kong style breakfast and Afternoon tea soon. I can't wait to try all of them!!
author: Kam Sing L.

description: Salt&pepper chicken wings is the best what I tried !it comes with soup,egg roll and rice only $7.50! Great service & fast! I will back again with my family next time
author: Anna L.

description: This place was such a disappointment. Yes, it is on the cheaper side, and yes, they give you a TON of chow mein, but I had some serious problems with their spring rolls: I bit into one and almost broke one of my molars on something that may or may not have been a shard of bone. So not cool, especially in the VEGGIE spring rolls! The chow mein was okay, as chow mein goes. Their cheesecake however, was clearly the same Cheesecake Factory mini cheesecake you can get from Safeway... they  just cut into super small slices, and marked each piece up to almost  $5. I don't recommend this place at all.
author: Ashleigh N.

description: Ordered here for food delivery a few times....   Great food and prices....   The best part is that they deliver to everywhere...    If you are looking for a quick meal pickup or delivery, make sure you give these guys a try
author: anthony c.

description: One of the best spot for delivery Chinese food. I like their salt pepper chicken wings and spicy tofu with pork.  It's always my first choice when I starve for chicken wings! Also they have very tasty stir fried beef rice noodle. It always satisfy my stomach with good potion. Gonna try more of their other food too :) good job wok station!
author: Geass L.

description: Nothing fancy but worth every dollar.  I ordered party trays from Wok Station couple times - decent price, generous amount, good food.  Will order from there again.
author: Shirley C.

description: Waited 15 minutes for my food and when I got it to go, they forgot my salted fish on my order of "salted fish and chicken fried rice".. they also forgot my side order of rice.. the food was slightly under okay
author: Steven L.

description: I read other reviews, like they said, it is not expensive with well quality. The portions of the fried rice is generous. The restaurant is not too big, and I can smell when my order is coming up. Most of the people ordered grub and go, so the restaurant is not too noise. I can enjoy my dinner there. The only improvement they need is to offer more beverages and not only soda and hot tea and water. Maybe milk tea and lemon tea and coffee. Overall is good.
author: philip n.

description: I ordered party trays . They delivered on time, great food without MSG and fair price! Recommend
author: V T.

description: First time here for lunch and exceed my expectations, the fried rice is really good with that price.  For sure will come back again.
author: S A.

description: Thank you Wok Station for the party trays. Very tasty Chinese food especially the chow mein.
author: Angela Sze Chai L.

description: Come here for lunch and ordered the Korean chicken wings and fried noodle. Both of the dishes are tasty especially the Korean chicken wings,  the wings are big and full of sauce. Definitely will come back for lunch.
author: angel w.

description: I ordered delivery from here for the first time tonight.  The delivery was 30 minutes late and everything was less than room temperature.  The sweet & sour pork would have been fair if it had been warm and fresh.  The Mongolian beef was about 1/2 chewable.  The rice was cold and stuck together.  With all of the Chinese restaurants in SF to choose from, I will skip this one.
author: John H.

description: We had a party for 30. I worked with Boris who helped me put together a menu. The food was ready on time and the group helped me carry it to the car. The food was great and exactly as expected, there was a little something for everyone.   Also, the price was spot on. Thank you guys!
author: Aaron K.

description: A small place with huge menu. Tasty food and they do delivery! Would definitely coming back again or call delivery to try their other goodies!!
author: Wendi Z.

description: Their delivery was pretty fast, and the food taste are less oil and less msg, the fried noodles and fried rice are delicious, pretty good food actually. Can be patronize again and I think I will introduce to my friends referring about those party tray, it seems good ideas for some gatherings.
author: Jacky H.

description: A pretty decent place to eat. Was there a couple times. Food is great. The owner actually comp'ed soup and appetizer once!
author: Vince Q.

description: Tasty food, especially the salt and pepper chicken wings and Singapore noodles, they are best in town. Reasonable price and they are doing "made to order" style, takes around 10 mins for 3 orders. The food is freshly cook and hot. I will probably go back and try again. Recommended
author: Cattie W.

description: I went to this place recently after I grab a cup of milktea at Itea. It was pretty empty during my visit. It's kind of small but the dinning area is clean. I ordered a noodle soup and fired rice. The food is mediocre, nothing special. Taste not bad but no surprise. Just like Panda Express type of food. It's just some regular Chinese food. There's no Chinese fast food around, so in the future, if I'm in the area I may try something else from here.
author: Fiona C.

description: I love the lunch special only $7.50 very much,and everything made in salt&pepper tasted great,the beef&soy sauce chow fun is the best what I tried in SF,what's a excellent restaurant!!!
author: Liu J.

description: I ordered chow mein, veggies tasted funny. Crab puffs only 4 per portion. Sesame chicken was good tho.
author: Giulia D.

description: I have ordered for delivery today. The guy bought me the food was spilled all over the bag on the bottom, I asked him why ? He told me that he got it from the restaurant just liked that. I have nothing to say . I would not order anymore from them . I asked menu ,forks and they didn't have for me. Bad customer service and took to long for delivery.
author: Lili L.

description: Hard to find a Chinese restaurant in the Sunset, without MSG in their food :)
author: Jasmine C.

description: i order scramble egg, shrimp rice noodle.  it's  a very typical Cantonese dish, but i didn't like theirs.  some parts of the rice noodle were still cold, i can't  believe it.  the chef needs to improve his stir fry technique.    and it's not that cheap, came out 11dollars.  i got the 2 free chicken wings, tastless.  the chairs were not comfortable at all, need some cushions.  this is a good location, but turnover rate is high.  don't know why,  maybe there's no quality in all the food.
author: Lucy J.

description: The food was ok, but I had to purchase white rice to go with my shrimp and broccoli. I thought it should have been included with the entrée.
author: Letticia G.

description: Ordered for delivery through Yelp.  Very quick response.  Good food but...  Mongolian Lamb, medium spicy, tasted good but was a little too oily.  Bonus spring rolls were also kind of greasy.  Also got a complimentary little appetizer of pepper and salt fried chicken wings. Nice and crispy but the bones weren't cooked all the way through. Prawns with crispy walnuts was tops. Some reviews compared this to Panda Express.  There is no comparison.  Wok station is much superior and much more authenti. All in all everything is very tasty but some dishes need a little fine tuning.
author: Enoch A.

description: 5 stars for No MSG! I also like the way how they use foil to cover food from plastic box.
author: Khang D.

description: Ordered delivery here. First of all the order was an hr later than the estimated delivery time. Sesame chicken was 90% flour and 10% chicken. Tastes like shit. Salt and pepper chicken wings were soggy af. Will never order from here again.
author: Martin C.

description: First time getting deliver from them, 4 people playing mahjong at home and no one wants to go get food, you know how it is.....walnut prawns, combo chow mein, Mongolian beef, egg roll, chicken fried rice. Everyone like it, food got there in about 20 min, deliver was on time and friendly, food was fresh and tasty. And can't beat the price too. Will definitely do it again, especially on a poker or mahjong night.
author: Hody L.

description: It's a small, delicious restaurant without all the frills. I usually get food to go, and everything has been great for its price so far! My favorites include the salt and pepper chicken wings, salted fish and chicken fried rice, and sesame chicken. Whenever I place a phone order, it only takes under 15 minutes.
author: Xing L.
